FuncDef:
The mpls lsr-id command sets the ID of an LSR.
The undo mpls lsr-id command deletes the ID of an LSR.
By default, no ID is configured for an LSR.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an LSR. The LSR ID is used to identify an LSR.
The LSR ID is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a network where MPLS services are deployed, you must configure the LSR IDs for devices.
An LSR does not have a default ID, and you must configure an ID for it.
It is recommended that the address of a loopback interface on an LSR be configured as the LSR ID.
Follow-up Procedure
You can configure MPLS and associated services.
Precautions
The undo mpls lsr-id command deletes existing LDP sessions and LSPs over the sessions. Execute caution when running this command.
If the mpls lsr-id command is run and the LSR ID is the same as the primary IP address of a loopback interface, note that:
The loopback interface cannot be bound to an L3VPN instance.The loopback interface cannot be deleted.The primary IP address of the loopback interface cannot be deleted or modified.
